# The `DenormalMode` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Represent subnormal handling kind for floating point instruction inputs and outputs. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Represent subnormal handling kind for floating point instruction inputs and outputs.

Definition at line 70 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/floatingpointmode-h">FloatingPointMode.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum llvm::DenormalMode::DenormalModeKind : int8&#95;t</>}>
Represent handled modes for denormal (aka subnormal) modes in the floating point environment.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893a72fe23f34a4f8005af6172748a69bc63" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Invalid">
 (= -1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893ad6fd23eb0b98a2d4551582753191b6da" />
<EnumerationListItem name="IEEE">
IEEE-754 denormal numbers preserved
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893a40bc80ae1d362a1461703637e946cbd8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="PreserveSign">
The sign of a flushed-to-zero number is preserved in the sign of 0
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893a7de61db082dcdc6e8d34d1c5fd2e9757" />
<EnumerationListItem name="PositiveZero">
Denormals are flushed to positive zero
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893ab6083e266013055b6c2ef85b1e47444c" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Dynamic">
Denormals have unknown treatment
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Get the effective denormal mode if the mode if this caller calls into a function with <code>Callee</code>.

This promotes dynamic modes to the mode of the caller.

## Public Member Attributes

### Input {#a1b79f1995991b0a757a4d04969c3717f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenormalModeKind llvm::DenormalMode::Input = <a href="#a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893a72fe23f34a4f8005af6172748a69bc63">DenormalModeKind::Invalid</a></>}>
Denormal treatment kind for floating point instruction inputs in the default floating-point environment.

If this is not <a href="#a29b26e3ae30f3f6ec4106ff181282893ad6fd23eb0b98a2d4551582753191b6da">DenormalModeKind::IEEE</a>, floating-point instructions implicitly treat the input value as 0.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/floatingpointmode-h/#l00096">96</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/floatingpointmode-h">FloatingPointMode.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Denormal flushing mode for floating point instruction results in the default floating point environment.
